summary: This document is a chain of emails from January 2020 regarding travel approval requests for a U.S. Attorney's Office team conducting interviews for the Epstein investigation (2018R01618). The emails detail logistical planning for trips to Stockholm, Sweden, Los Angeles, and West Palm Beach, Florida, including flight bookings, hotel arrangements, and conference room reservations for victim interviews.

persons.name: Alleyne
persons.context: Appears as a recipient copied on multiple travel approval request emails for the Epstein investigation team.

events.title: Planned travel to Stockholm for interview
events.description: A team plans to travel from JFK to Stockholm, Sweden, with layovers in Paris, to conduct an interview related to the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Planned travel to Los Angeles for interview
events.description: The team requested permission to travel to Los Angeles for an interview (or interviews) related to the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Planned travel to Los Angeles for interview
events.description: The team requested permission to travel to Los Angeles for an interview related to the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Planned travel to West Palm Beach for interview
events.description: A smaller team requested permission to travel to West Palm Beach for an interview related to the Epstein investigation, including reserving a conference room.

events.title: Planned travel to West Palm Beach for meetings/interviews
events.description: The team requested permission to travel to West Palm Beach for approximately three days for meetings and interviews with victims related to the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Planned travel to West Palm Beach for meetings/interviews
events.description: Prosecutors requested permission to travel to West Palm Beach for approximately three days for meetings and interviews related to United States v. Epstein.

events.title: Planned travel to West Palm Beach/Fort Lauderdale
events.description: Prosecutors requested permission to travel to West Palm Beach and/or Fort Lauderdale for two days of meetings and interviews related to United States v. Epstein.

keyFacts: The document references the ongoing federal investigation 'United States v. Epstein, 2018R01618', described as 'an investigation relating to enticement of minors for sexual activity'.

The prosecution team was actively conducting victim interviews in multiple locations (Sweden, Los Angeles, West Palm Beach) as late as January 2020, indicating the investigation was ongoing after Epstein's death.
Travel requests show a pattern of needing to book refundable tickets for international travel and seeking hotel conference rooms for conducting interviews.
The email chain reveals logistical coordination and approval processes within the U.S. Attorney's Office for investigation-related travel.
Multiple trips to West Palm Beach, Florida, are mentioned, which is a location central to Epstein's activities.
